page: ME41606: Finite Element Methods In Engineering

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Prerequsites: ME10602, 20604Introduction-Basic Concept of FEM, Methods of weighted residual techniques-Weak Formulation, Galerkin FE formulation, Rayleigh and Ritz FEM,FEM analysis of One-dimensional problems:-Second order boundary value problem, Applications in Solid, Fluid and Heat Transfer, Bending of Beams, Euler-Bernoulli Beam, Truss/Frame analysis, Eigenvalue and Time dependent problems, MATLAB Application, Numerical Integration and Computer Implementation-Natural Co-ordinates, Interpolation Functions, Numerical Integration, Isoparametric Formulation, Computer Implementation, Applications in two-dimensional problems-Plane Stress and plane Strain, Three Dimensional Solid, Axi-symmetric Solid, Plate and Shell structures, Flow of Viscous Fluid, MATLAB Application, Special Topics, Stationary Singular elements, Quarter-Point Singular Elements, Moving singular elements, Semi-infinite elements, Buckling analysis, Non-linear analysis
page: ME41606: Finite Element Methods In Engineering
